function.name: format_output

list_of_recommendation_sets.information: Research by Kennon M. Sheldon & Sonja Lyubomirsky (2006) suggests that practicing gratitude can increase positive emotions and overall well-being.
list_of_recommendation_sets.tip: Set aside 5-10 minutes each day to reflect on the things you are grateful for, no matter how small they may seem.

list_of_recommendation_sets.information: Study by Kennon M. Sheldon & Sonja Lyubomirsky (2006) found that visualizing best possible selves can increase motivation and self-concordance.
list_of_recommendation_sets.tip: Take 10-15 minutes each day to imagine your ideal future self, including your goals, aspirations, and values.

list_of_recommendation_sets.information: Research by Kennon M. Sheldon & Sonja Lyubomirsky (2006) suggests that engaging in activities that promote relaxation and stress reduction can improve overall well-being.
list_of_recommendation_sets.tip: Incorporate mindfulness practices, such as meditation or deep breathing, into your daily routine to help reduce stress and improve relaxation.

list_of_recommendation_sets.information: Study by Kennon M. Sheldon & Sonja Lyubomirsky (2006) found that setting goals and working towards them can increase motivation and self-regulation.
list_of_recommendation_sets.tip: Set specific, achievable goals for yourself each day, and prioritize tasks to help increase productivity and motivation.

list_of_recommendation_sets.information: Research by Kennon M. Sheldon & Sonja Lyubomirsky (2006) suggests that engaging in activities that align with values and interests can increase motivation and self-concordance.
list_of_recommendation_sets.tip: Schedule time with friends or family each week, and prioritize activities that bring you joy and fulfillment.
